publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5555 Bill Wilson: Renfrew Ferry—That the Parliament regrets the proposal by the Labour-dominated Strathclyde Partnership for Transport (SPT) to close the Renfrew Ferry, a centuries-old crossing of the Clyde that currently provides 140,000 passenger journeys every year; notes the importance of this connection for the people of Renfrew and Yoker, and calls on the SPT not to remove this vital connection between Glasgow and Renfrewshire. Supported by: Stuart McMillan*, John Wilson*
S3M-5555 Renfrew Ferry (lodged on 18 January 2010) Christopher Harvie*, Rob Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Gil Paterson*, Stewart Maxwell*

S3M-5555 Bill Wilson: Renfrew Ferry—That the Parliament regrets the proposal by the Labour-dominated Strathclyde Partnership for Transport (SPT) to close the Renfrew Ferry, a centuries-old crossing of the Clyde that currently provides 140,000 passenger journeys every year; notes the importance of this connection for the people of Renfrew and Yoker, and calls on the SPT not to remove this vital connection between Glasgow and Renfrewshire. Supported by: Stuart McMillan, John Wilson, Christopher Harvie, Rob Gibson, Bob Doris, Gil Paterson, Stewart Maxwell
S3M-5555 Renfrew Ferry (lodged on 18 January 2010) Kenneth Gibson*, Willie Coffey*
